column4: The default printing GUI in Xubuntu is a bit limited. Is there an alternative?
you mean the printer configuration? the ui in apps for printing should be the same regardless of the DE (as long as it's gtk)
I mean the GUI you see when you print a photo for example. My parents are not happy with the default one.
you might need to look to another app thats printing the picture and hope its changes to the dialogue suffice
the print preview stuff is weird in firefox tho, can't do much about that
I can say they're not nuts. ;) My mom prints a lot of photos and it's not easy enough to place multiple photos on one page without using an image editor.
ya, that's why i'm saying you should sooner look to an app that's better at printing photos
k
something that lets you arrange photos on the paper or something, that's not a job for the print dialogue proper
unfortunately the only app i know personally that does that, is picasa :\
Ok, I'll probably try to make something myself then.
you could install them all and let the parents pick :]
hehe, they don't have time to try things. It just has to work. Can't do much about that.
shotwell and f-spot are on the shortlist, but only because i don't know of any others :D
I tried Shotwell. Printing is a bit limited.
You can only adjust the size of the image.
good luck, picasa is available for linux; just not in the repos
Do you perhaps know if there's a Printing API for Python in Ubuntu?
if there is it won't be able to do what you're looking to do
Why not?
the print dialogue isn't the place to arrange photos and stuff, it needs to be done by the app before that
My mom just needs to be able to select a few photos in THunar and then print them (on one page or something else). I can make a GUI for that.
i suppose, but that's something different entirely :]
Yea ^^
